phases.name: Phase 1 – Hardware Foundations & Modern Embedded C++
phases.description: Calibrate hardware lab, sharpen modern C++ for microcontrollers, and build disciplined debugging habits. End goal: confidently shipping bring-up firmware on STM32 and ESP32 targets.

phases.name: Phase 2 – Real-Time Systems & Connected Firmware
phases.description: Deepen RTOS mastery, tackle open RISC-V/ESP32-C3 bring-up, design resilient connectivity stacks, and harden security for fleet-ready firmware. Culminates in a production-quality Zephyr/FreeRTOS application spanning CAN, Ethernet, BLE, and secure provisioning.

phases.name: Phase 3 – Edge Intelligence, Safety & Manufacturing Readiness
phases.description: Blend TinyML with safety-critical practices, Android Automotive integration, and manufacturing readiness. Harden products for compliance while building intelligent firmware paired with production test rigs and certification artefacts.

phases.name: Phase 4 – Productization, Launch & Career Amplification
phases.description: Polish the product experience, finalize launch readiness, and translate achievements into standout portfolio assets. Concludes with simulated launch, community contributions, and career outreach campaign.

phases.name: Phase 3.5 – Embedded Linux Bridge
phases.description: Bridge from bare-metal to Linux: Kernel modules, Device Trees, and Drivers.

weeks.focus: Week 01 – Electronics Foundations for STM32 Development
Week 02 – Circuit simulation sprints & power supply literacy
Week 03 – Digital logic blueprints & finite-state thinking
Week 04 – ARM Cortex-M Architecture & STM32 MCU Deep Dive
Week 05 – C programming foundations & syntax fluency

Week 13 – Safety basics & design for reliability

Week 18 Focus – Advanced DMA Patterns & Multi-channel DMA
Week 19 – CAN/CAN-FD Physical Layer & LIN Protocol
Week 22 – Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) & MQTT Publish/Subscribe
Week 23 – Ethernet, TCP/IP, LwIP & MQTT Broker Integration
Week 27 – Observability, logging, and remote diagnostics
Week 30 – Phase consolidation, demos, and midterm review
Week 32 – Edge AI & TinyML Sensor Preprocessing
Week 33 – Sensor fusion with ML & adaptive algorithms
Week 35 – USB Device/Host Mode & High-Speed Protocols
Week 36 – Functional safety standards deep dive
Week 38 – Android Automotive HAL & security operations
Week 44 – AUTOSAR Fundamentals for Automotive Embedded
Week 42 – Supply chain resilience & lifecycle management
Week 47 – Linux Kernel Modules & Build System (Kbuild)
Week 45 – Phase integration, storytelling, and demo
Week 47 – UX refinement & embedded UI polish
Week 51 – Security audits & red team drills
Week 68 – SystemVerilog Basics for HW/SW Co-Design (Optional)
Week 69 – Rust for Embedded Systems (Optional Advanced)
Week 70 – Applied Embedded Math & DSP (Stanford Gap Fixer)
